definitions: Past tense of shave: to remove hair from the skin's surface with a razor or other sharp instrument.
Past tense of shave: to cut a thin slice or a small amount from the surface of something.
Past tense of shave: to reduce something by a small amount.
examples: He shaved his beard this morning.
The carpenter shaved a thin layer off the wood.
They shaved a few seconds off the record time.
